00030 /**

00033 require_once 'Bee/Exception.php';

00035 /**
00036  * Input filtering. Removes bad characters and reduces potential injection vectors
00037  *
00038  * @category   Colony
00039  * @package    Bee
00040  * @copyright  Copyright (c) Army of Bees (www.armyofbees.com)
00041  * @license    http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php MIT License
00042  */
00043 class Bee_Input 
00044 {
00045     /**
00046      * Cached input data
00047      * @var array
00048      */
00049     private static $input = null;
00050 
00051         /**
00052          * Cleans input. Caches locally.
00053          *
00054          * Takes all available $_GET, $_POST, and $_COOKIE input and reduces the
00055          * chances of attacks and problems.
00056          *
00057          * Also cleans the source IP address.
00058          *
00059          * @return array The cleaned input
00060          */
00061         public static function &filterInput()
00062         {
00063                 global $HTTP_CLIENT_IP, $REQUEST_METHOD, $REMOTE_ADDR, $HTTP_PROXY_USER, $HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR;
00064 
00065                 if( self::$input == null )
00066                 {
00067             $super = array( &$_GET, &$_POST, &$_COOKIE );
00068 
00069             $return = array();
00070             foreach( $super as $duper )
00071             {
00072                 if( is_array( $duper ) )
00073                 {
00074                     foreach( $duper as $k => $v )
00075                     {
00076                         if( is_array( $duper[$k] ) )
00077                         {
00078                             foreach( $duper[$k] as $k2 => $v2 )
00079                             {   
00080                                 if( is_array( $duper[$k][$k2] ) )
00081                                 {
00082                                     foreach( $duper[$k][$k2] as $k3 => $v3 )
00083                                         $return[ self::cleanKey($k) ][ self::cleanKey($k2) ][ self::cleanKey( $k3 ) ] = self::cleanValue( $v3 );
00084                                 }
00085                                 else
00086                                     $return[ self::cleanKey($k) ][ self::cleanKey( $k2 ) ] = self::cleanValue( $v2 );
00087                             }
00088                         }
00089                         else
00090                             $return[ self::cleanKey($k) ] = self::cleanValue( $v );
00091                     }
00092                 }
00093             }
00094 
00095             // Sort out the accessing IP
00096             $return['IP_ADDRESS'] = $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'];
00097             $return['IP_ADDRESS'] = preg_replace( "/^([0-9]{1,3})\.([0-9]{1,3})\.([0-9]{1,3})\.([0-9]{1,3})/", 
00098                                                   "\\1.\\2.\\3.\\4", 
00099                                                   $return['IP_ADDRESS'] );
00100 
00101             $return['REQUEST_METHOD'] = strtolower( $REQUEST_METHOD );
00102 
00103             self::$input = $return;
00104         }
00105 
00106                 return self::$input;
00107         }
00108 
00109         /**
00110          * Handles some potential exploits with key names
00111          * 
00112          * @param string $key The key to clean
00113          * @return string The cleaned key
00114          */
00115     public static function cleanKey( $key ) 
00116     {
00117         if ( $key == "" )
00118         {
00119                 return "";
00120         }
00121         
00122         $key = str_replace(  ".."               , ""  , $key );
00123         $key = preg_replace( "/\_\_(.+?)\_\_/"  , ""  , $key );
00124         $key = preg_replace( "/^([\w\.\-\_]+)$/", "$1", $key );
00125         
00126         return $key;
00127     }
00128 
00129         /**
00130          * Cleans a value
00131          *
00132          * Handles most problems with SQL queries. Not neccessarily safe for 
00133          * input displayed back to other users.
00134          *
00135          * @param mixed $val The value to clean
00136          * @return string The cleaned value
00137          */
00138     public static function cleanValue( $val ) 
00139     {
00140         if ( $val == "" )
00141         {
00142                 return "";
00143         }
00144  
00145                 if ( get_magic_quotes_gpc() )
00146         {
00147                 $val = stripslashes($val);
00148         }
00149         
00150         $val = htmlentities( $val, ENT_QUOTES );
00151 
00152         return $val;
00153     }
00154     
00155         /**
00156          * Cleans a value.
00157          *
00158          * Handles more potential problems with input, such as XSS attacks.
00159          *
00160          * @param mixed $val The value to clean
00161          * @return string The cleaned value
00162          */
00163     public static function cleanerValue( $val ) 
00164     {
00165         if ( $val == "" )
00166         {
00167                 return "";
00168         }
00169         
00170         $replace = array(  "&#032;" => " ",
00171                                            chr(0xCA) => "",
00172                                            "&" => "&amp;",
00173                                            "<\!--" => "&#60;&#33;--",
00174                                            "-->" => "--&#62;",
00175                                            "!" => "&#33;",
00176                                            "'" => "&#39;",
00177                                            ">" => "&gt;",
00178                                            "<" => "&lt;",
00179                                            "\"" => "&quot;" );
00180                                            
00181         $val = str_replace( array_keys( $replace ), $replace,  $val );
00182         
00183         $replace = array( "/<script/i" => "&#60;script",
00184                                           "/\|/" => "&#124;",
00185                                           "/\n/" => "<br>", 
00186                                           "/\\\$/" => "&#036;",
00187                                           "/\r/" => "", 
00188                                           "/\\\/" => "&#092;" );
00189                                           
00190         $val = preg_replace( array_keys( $replace ), $replace,  $val );
00191 
00192                 if ( get_magic_quotes_gpc() )
00193         {
00194                 $val = stripslashes( $val );
00195         }
00196 
00197         return $val;
00198     }
00199 }
00200 
00201 class Bee_Input_Exception extends Bee_Exception
00202 {}
